row.entry: Cyan is a nice color touchup for black and white images, this example guides you through how to make this with darktable and how to control the tone. You can choose any tone of your like for this tutorial...

sect3.title: Procedure
sect3.para: This procedure uses tonecurve, channelmixer and splittoning modules.

listitem.para: Prepare the image for the cyan toned steps by adjusting the base settings such as exposure,black level, contrast etc. for a correctly looking image.
Enable the monochrome module to make the image black and white.
This step selects the basetone of the image using channel mixer, we are going for cyan tone but you can choose the tone of your like here.
Select red channel and set red color value to 0.7
Select green channel and red color value to 0.150
Select blue channel and red color value to 0.150
As you notice we mix blue and green color to get a cyan tone, we substract 0.3 from red channel and add them to blue and green.

The result of previous step does also add a colorcast on highlight that we actually want to have white for a prettier result. We also wants to add some blue color cast to the shadows to emphasis them.
Select a blue/cyan tone for shadows and set saturation around 50%
Set highlights saturation to zero, to remove saturation on highlights.
Use the balance slider to tune the effect, our example uses a balance of 70/30
